content.description: Stand start for this warm-up or cool down on this slab. Starting hands are about shoulder height with tiny indents for your feet. Work up to the right on a crimp the up over the top.
content.location: It is on the backside of Little Mario right next to the downclimb.

content.description: The sit start goes as a V2, and the stand start goes as V1 (sit start it worth it).For the sit start, use a decent, right foot, downward triangle on a rail and place your left foot wide around the arete. Your right hand goes in the second from the bottom slot of the crack and your left hand starts on a sharp pinch. Tossing your left hand up to the solid knob just behind the arete is the second move, and keep working the crack on the right with some help from the left arete to finish the climb.For the stand start, start with your left hand on the knob just behind the left arete and your right higher up in the crack than the sit start. Your feet go on the face and lower rail.
content.location: If facing the main face with Test Dummy Left and Right, go to the right, and the face will have an obvious crack to work from.

content.description: Squat start or stack a few pads as for the problem Test Dummy Left, but move left after a move or two, then set up to grab the high crimp with your right hand, surge for the lip, and top out.
content.location: It shares the same start as for the problem Test Dummy Left.

content.description: Squat start or stack a few pads with your left hand on a giant blocky granite side pull/pinch and your right hand on a tiny crimp. Pop left and then right to a decent sidepull, get a good foot, launch for the small crimp with your left hand, then move right to a good flake, and top out. This is harder than it looks.
content.location: This problem starts about 7-8 feet left of the far right arête on the gently overhanging white face.

content.description: Squat start or stack a few pads as for the problems Test Dummy Left and Right, move left 4-5 feet and then up the prow, and top out.
content.location: Do the same start as for the Test Dummy problems. This problem starts roughly 7-8 feet left of the far right end arete on the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with your right hand low on the right arête and your left hand on a decent sidepull/ramp. Move up, and traverse left on crimps to join the problem Moonshine Arete, and top out.
content.location: This ascends the right arête on the overhanging black face you first reach from the trail.

content.description: Sit start the far left arête and top out.
content.location: This ascends the far left arête on the black side of the boulder.

content.description: Little Mario Boulder is a decent block with a few problems on it.
